paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene, specifically the V30M mutation, and provides penetrance data for carriers of this variant.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Plasma from asymptomatic V30M carriers (n = 200) and symptomatic heterozygotic (n = 12) were tested.
Plasma samples from asymptomatic (n = 180) were obtained.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation leads to the production of a glycosylated form of TTR that is detectable in plasma.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the presence of a slow migrating TTR band in V30M carriers.
key_quotes: The intensity of the reaction did not correlate between hetero and homozygotic patients.
Plasma from asymptomatic V30M carriers (n = 200) and symptomatic heterozygotic (n = 12) were tested.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR gene and provided clear data.
